ch.blinkenlights.android.vanilla

Class SongTimeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.blinkenlights.android.vanilla.SongTimeline

  • public final class SongTimeline
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the list of currently playing songs, implements repeat and shuffle support, and contains methods to fetch more songs from the MediaStore.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SongTimeline.Callback
      Interface to respond to timeline changes.
      static class  SongTimeline.FlagComparator
      Compares the flags of songs.
      static class  SongTimeline.IdComparator
      Compares the ids of songs.

      Enqueues the result as next item(s) Pass the position in QueryTask.data.

      Like enqueue mode, but make the song with the given id play first by removing the songs before the song in the query and appending them to the end of the queue.

      Like enqueue mode, but make the song at the given position play first by removing the songs before the given position in the query and appending them to the end of the queue.

      Clear the queue and add the songs after the current song.

    • Field Detail

      • FINISH_STOP

        public static final int FINISH_STOP
        Stop playback.
        See Also:
        setFinishAction(int), Constant Field Values

      • FINISH_REPEAT

        public static final int FINISH_REPEAT
        Repeat from the beginning.
        See Also:
        setFinishAction(int), Constant Field Values

      • FINISH_REPEAT_CURRENT

        public static final int FINISH_REPEAT_CURRENT
        Repeat the current song. This behavior is implemented entirely in PlaybackService.onCompletion(android.media.MediaPlayer); pressing the next or previous buttons will advance the song as normal; only allowing the song to play until the end will repeat it.
        See Also:
        setFinishAction(int), Constant Field Values

      • FINISH_STOP_CURRENT

        public static final int FINISH_STOP_CURRENT
        Stop playback after current song. This behavior is implemented entirely in PlaybackService.onCompletion(android.media.MediaPlayer); pressing the next or previous buttons will advance the song as normal; only allowing the song to play until the end.
        See Also:
        setFinishAction(int), Constant Field Values

      • FINISH_RANDOM

        public static final int FINISH_RANDOM
        Add random songs to the playlist.
        See Also:
        setFinishAction(int), Constant Field Values

      • FINISH_ICONS

        public static final int[] FINISH_ICONS
        Icons corresponding to each of the finish actions.

      • MODE_PLAY

        public static final int MODE_PLAY
        Clear the timeline and use only the provided songs.
        See Also:
        addSongs(Context, QueryTask), Constant Field Values

      • MODE_FLUSH_AND_PLAY_NEXT

        public static final int MODE_FLUSH_AND_PLAY_NEXT
        Clear the queue and add the songs after the current song.
        See Also:
        addSongs(Context, QueryTask), Constant Field Values

      • MODE_ENQUEUE

        public static final int MODE_ENQUEUE
        Add the songs at the end of the timeline, clearing random songs.
        See Also:
        addSongs(Context, QueryTask), Constant Field Values

      • MODE_PLAY_POS_FIRST

        public static final int MODE_PLAY_POS_FIRST
        Like play mode, but make the song at the given position play first by removing the songs before the given position in the query and appending them to the end of the queue. Pass the position in QueryTask.data.
        See Also:
        addSongs(Context, QueryTask), Constant Field Values

      • MODE_PLAY_ID_FIRST

        public static final int MODE_PLAY_ID_FIRST
        Like play mode, but make the song with the given id play first by removing the songs before the song in the query and appending them to the end of the queue. If there are multiple songs with the given id, picks the first song with that id. Pass the id in QueryTask.data.
        See Also:
        addSongs(Context, QueryTask), Constant Field Values

      • MODE_ENQUEUE_ID_FIRST

        public static final int MODE_ENQUEUE_ID_FIRST
        Like enqueue mode, but make the song with the given id play first by removing the songs before the song in the query and appending them to the end of the queue. If there are multiple songs with the given id, picks the first song with that id. Pass the id in QueryTask.data.
        See Also:
        addSongs(Context, QueryTask), Constant Field Values

      • MODE_ENQUEUE_POS_FIRST

        public static final int MODE_ENQUEUE_POS_FIRST
        Like enqueue mode, but make the song at the given position play first by removing the songs before the given position in the query and appending them to the end of the queue. Pass the position in QueryTask.data.
        See Also:
        addSongs(Context, QueryTask), Constant Field Values

      • MODE_ENQUEUE_AS_NEXT

        public static final int MODE_ENQUEUE_AS_NEXT
        Enqueues the result as next item(s) Pass the position in QueryTask.data.
        See Also:
        addSongs(Context, QueryTask), Constant Field Values

      • SHUFFLE_NONE

        public static final int SHUFFLE_NONE
        Disable shuffle.
        See Also:
        setShuffleMode(int), Constant Field Values

      • SHUFFLE_SONGS

        public static final int SHUFFLE_SONGS
        Randomize order of songs.
        See Also:
        setShuffleMode(int), Constant Field Values

        public static final int SHUFFLE_ALBUMS
        Randomize order of albums, preserving the order of tracks inside the albums.

    • Method Detail

      • readState

        public void readState(java.io.DataInputStream in)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the timeline with data read from the stream. Data should have been saved by a call to writeState(DataOutputStream).
        Parameters:
        in - The stream to read from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeState

        public void writeState(java.io.DataOutputStream out)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the current songs and state to the given stream.
        Parameters:
        out - The stream to write to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(SongTimeline.Callback callback)
        Sets the current callback to callback.

      • getShuffleMode

        public int getShuffleMode()
        Return the current shuffle mode.
        Returns:
        The shuffle mode. One of SongTimeline.SHUFFLE_*.

      • getFinishAction

        public int getFinishAction()
        Return the finish action.
        See Also:
        setFinishAction(int)

      • setShuffleMode

        public void setShuffleMode(int mode)
        Set how to shuffle. Will shuffle the current set of songs when enabling shuffling if random mode is not enabled.
        Parameters:
        mode - One of SongTimeline.MODE_*

      • setFinishAction

        public void setFinishAction(int action)
        Set what to do when the end of the playlist is reached. Must be one of SongTimeline.FINISH_* (stop, repeat, or add random song).

      • getSong

        public Song getSong(int delta)
        Returns the song delta places away from the current position. Returns null if there is a problem retrieving the song.
        Parameters:
        delta - The offset from the current position. Must be -1, 0, or 1.

      • setCurrentQueuePosition

        public Song setCurrentQueuePosition(int pos)
        Hard-Jump to given queue position

      • getSongByQueuePosition

        public Song getSongByQueuePosition(int id)
        Returns 'Song' at given position in queue

      • shiftCurrentSong

        public Song shiftCurrentSong(int delta)
        Move to the next or previous song or album.
        Parameters:
        delta - One of SongTimeline.SHIFT_*.
        Returns:
        The Song at the new position

      • addSongs

        public int addSongs(android.content.Context context,
                    QueryTask query)
        Run the given query and add the results to the song timeline.
        Parameters:
        context - A context to use.
        query - The query to be run. The mode variable must be initialized to one of SongTimeline.MODE_*. The type and data variables may also need to be initialized depending on the given mode.
        Returns:
        The number of songs that were added.

      • clearQueue

        public void clearQueue()
        Clear the song queue.

      • emptyQueue

        public void emptyQueue()
        Empty the song queue (clear the whole queue).

      • removeSong

        public void removeSong(long id)
        Remove the song with the given id from the timeline.
        Parameters:
        id - The MediaStore id of the song to remove.

      • removeSongPosition

        public void removeSongPosition(int pos)
        Removes song in timeline at given position
        Parameters:
        pos - index to use

      • moveSongPosition

        public void moveSongPosition(int from,
                             int to)
        Moves a song in the timeline to a new position
        Parameters:
        from - index to move from
        to - index to move to

      • isEndOfQueue

        public boolean isEndOfQueue()
        Return true if the finish action is to stop at the end of the queue and the current song is the last in the queue.

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        Returns the position of the current song in the timeline.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns the current number of songs in the timeline.
